basics.name: Espen Hovlandsdal
basics.label: Full-stack developer
basics.summary: Espen has been doing web development for as long as he can remember. He is currently a full-stack developer at Sanity.io - a platform for structured content, delivering developer-friendly APIs and a modern, collaborative, headless content management system. With a never-ending enthusiasm for programming, he loves taking on projects big and small, and is always seeking to find new ways to challenge himself. When he can break away from coding he enjoys playing board games, taking his miniature schnauzer for long walks or drinking craft beer and thinking about the next project to play with.

work.summary: Structured content platform with a customizable, headless CMS built in React.
highlights: Created the command-line tool, development server and command-line signup experience
Made microservices for handling users, projects, datasets, webhooks and deployments
Developed the building blocks for the headless content management system user interface
Created API gateway plugins for handling sessions, cross-origin security and caching
Built a real-time image transformation service for resizing, cropping etc
Created libraries for rendering and manipulating the portable text format

work.summary: Bengler invents unlikely and interesting uses for technology.
highlights: Developed the ground work and initial version of Sanity, a headless content management system using React and Node.js, focusing on a great developer experience.
For fun: Built an automatic foosball score keeping and player ranking system connected to a physical foosball table

work.summary: VG is a tabloid newspaper and the most read news site in Norway. Worked on a large range of products, everything from internal APIs and microservices to frontend and backend coding a social network.
highlights: Developed a social network where pet owners can share stories, pictures, videos and experiences. User-created groups and "herds" based on their pets species is a key feature.
Created a site to gather all the stories from Norwegians around the world, sharing how we experienced July 22nd 2011, when Norway lost 77 lives to terrorist attacks.
Built service to allow searching the tax returns of citizens, comparing the income and tax levels of municipalities, zip codes and similar.

work.summary: VaffelNinja is a small Oslo-based company with a passion for open source and the web. We're currently working on a few secret projects, as well as maintaining React-Components.com.
highlights: Created the fully open-source React-Components.com - built with and for React.JS.

work.summary: Go Mobile is a consulting company which builds rich, interactive solutions for web and mobile platforms. Worked on several backends for mobile applications, and spent most of the time as a consultant working for Verdens Gang AS.
highlights: Built new forum software for one of the largest online communities in Norway, currently over 40 million posts
Helped build a subscription-based service that helps people lose weight
Developed VG Live, a real-time sports update service alongside live, streaming video from sports matches
